question: A square loop of side 2 cm enters a magnetic field with a constant speed of <katex>$2cm~s^{-1}$</katex> as shown. The front edge enters the field at <katex>$t=0s$</katex>. Which of the following graph correctly depicts the induced emf in the loop? (Take clockwise direction positive)
images/question_10.png
explanation: As the loop enters the field (0 to 1s), flux increases into the page. By Lenz's law, induced current opposes this, creating outward flux (Counter-Clockwise). If Clockwise is positive, emf is negative.

While completely inside (1s to 5s), flux is constant, so emf is zero. (Field width is 10cm, loop is 2cm. <katex>$(10)/2 = 5s$</katex> to cross? No, distance to traverse fully inside is <katex>$10-2 = 8cm$</katex>. Time <katex>$= 4s$</katex>. So from t=1 to t=5.)
As it leaves (5s to 6s), flux decreases. Induced current tries to maintain flux, so it is Clockwise (Positive).
Graph B shows: Negative constant emf for 0-1s, Zero for 1-5s, Positive constant emf for 5-6s.
